title: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

title: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

title: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

title: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
author: Mencius

title: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
author: John Leonard

title: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
author: Len Wein

title: Things are never quite as scary when you've got a best friend.
author: Bill Watterson

title: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

title: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
author: Marlene Dietrich

title: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

title: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
author: Ethel Barrymore

title: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.
author: Toni Morrison

title: Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't.
author: Judy Holliday

title: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
author: Thomas Aquinas

title: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
author: William Butler Yeats

title: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
author: Alice Walker

title: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
author: John Webster

title: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
author: Marcel Proust

title: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

title: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

title: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

title: Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

title: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
author: Baltasar Gracian

title: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

title: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

title: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
author: Margaret Walker

title: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
author: Charles Darwin

title: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
author: Octavia E. Butler

title: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
author: Mencius

title: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

title: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

title: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
author: Khalil Gibran

title: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
author: Doug Larson

title: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

title: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel

title: If you have one true friend you have more than your share.
author: Thomas Fuller

title: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
author: Baltasar Gracian

title: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.
author: Henri Nouwen

title: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
author: Anais Nin

title: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
author: Albert Schweitzer

title: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
author: Shirley MacLaine

title: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
author: Washington Irving

title: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
author: Walt Whitman

title: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
author: Plutarch

title: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
author: William Blake

title: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: A friend to all is a friend to none.
author: Aristotle

title: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
author: Henri Nouwen

title: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.
author: Thomas Jefferson

title: When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

title: All you need to do to be my friend is like me.
author: Taylor Swift

title: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
author: Elbert Hubbard

title: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

title: You find out who your real friends are when you're involved in a scandal.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

title: Friends are born, not made.
author: Henry Adams

title: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
author: Oprah Winfrey

title: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
author: Leo Buscaglia

title: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

title: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

title: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
author: Laurence J. Peter

title: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

title: True friends stab you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us, as the confidence of their help.
author: Epicurus

title: Where would you be without friends? The people to pick you up when you need lifting? We come from homes far from perfect, so you end up almost parent and sibling to your friends - your own chosen family. There's nothing like a really loyal, dependable, good friend. Nothing.
author: Jennifer Aniston

title: The real test of friendship is: can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?
author: Eugene Kennedy

title: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

title: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
author: Herodotus

title: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

title: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
author: Charles Eastman

title: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
author: Thomas Aquinas

title: As iron sharpens iron, so a friend sharpens a friend.
author: King Solomon

title: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

title: A friend should be one in whose understanding and virtue we can equally confide, and whose opinion we can value at once for its justness and its sincerity.
author: Robert Hall

title: A friend in power is a friend lost.
author: Henry Adams

title: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
author: Khalil Gibran

title: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

title: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

title: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
author: Abraham Lincoln

title: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
author: Richard Burton

title: Men kick friendship around like a football, but it doesn't seem to crack. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

title: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
author: William Penn

title: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

title: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.
author: Henry Ford

title: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

title: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
author: Henry Van Dyke

title: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
author: Plautus

title: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
author: E. W. Howe

title: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

title: Friends are the best to turn to when you're having a rough day.
author: Justin Bieber

title: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
author: John D. Rockefeller

title: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
author: George Santayana

title: My definition of a friend is somebody who adores you even though they know the things you're most ashamed of.
author: Jodie Foster

title: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.
author: Robert E. Lee

title: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
author: Jim Morrison

title: Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
author: Augustine Birrell

title: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
author: Aristotle

title: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.
author: E. W. Howe

title: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
author: George Washington

title: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

title: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

title: We call that person who has lost his father, an orphan; and a widower that man who has lost his wife. But that man who has known the immense unhappiness of losing a friend, by what name do we call him? Here every language is silent and holds its peace in impotence.
author: Joseph Roux

title: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

title: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.
author: Herman Melville

title: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

title: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.
author: Pam Brown

title: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
author: Giotto di Bondone

title: Many a person has held close, throughout their entire lives, two friends that always remained strange to one another, because one of them attracted by virtue of similarity, the other by difference.
author: Emil Ludwig

title: Friendship and money: oil and water.
author: Mario Puzo

title: I always felt that the great high privilege, relief and comfort of friendship was that one had to explain nothing.
author: Katherine Mansfield

title: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
author: Thomas Jefferson

title: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
author: Confucius

title: If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.
author: George MacDonald

title: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: How delightful to find a friend in everyone.
author: Joseph Brodsky

title: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

title: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
author: Euripides

title: He who hath many friends hath none.
author: Aristotle

title: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.
author: Honore de Balzac

title: My friends are my estate.
author: Emily Dickinson

title: Never have a companion that casts you in the shade.
author: Baltasar Gracian

title: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
author: Chanakya

title: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
author: Aristotle

title: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: If it's very painful for you to criticize your friends - you're safe in doing it. But if you take the slightest pleasure in it, that's the time to hold your tongue.
author: Alice Miller

title: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
author: George Jean Nathan

title: When friendship disappears then there is a space left open to that awful loneliness of the outside world which is like the cold space between the planets. It is an air in which men perish utterly.
author: Hilaire Belloc

title: Never make friends with people who are above or below you in status. Such friendships will never give you any happiness.
author: Chanakya

title: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
author: Khalil Gibran

title: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
author: Unknown

title: It seems to me that trying to live without friends is like milking a bear to get cream for your morning coffee. It is a whole lot of trouble, and then not worth much after you get it.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

title: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, Can never know what true friendship means.
author: Charles Kingsley

title: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

title: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
author: Sophocles

title: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
author: Confucius

title: Many a friendship, long, loyal, and self-sacrificing, rested at first on no thicker a foundation than a kind word.
author: Frederick William Faber

title: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

title: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
author: Thomas A. Edison

title: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
author: Robert Staughton Lynd

title: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
author: Socrates

title: Mighty proud I am that I am able to have a spare bed for my friends.
author: Samuel Pepys

title: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.
author: Saint Augustine

title: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

title: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

title: Our friends interpret the world and ourselves to us, if we take them tenderly and truly.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

title: To avoid being mistaken for a sellout, I chose my friends carefully. The more politically active black students. The foreign students. The Chicanos. The Marxist professors and structural feminists and punk-rock performance poets.
author: Barack Obama

title: Your friend is your needs answered.
author: Khalil Gibran

title: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.
author: Francis Quarles

title: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
author: Orson Welles

title: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

title: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Saint Basil

title: Friendship is a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

title: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

title: Share your smile with the world. It's a symbol of friendship and peace.
author: Christie Brinkley

title: I have learned that friendship isn't about who you've known the longest, it's about who came and never left your side.
author: Yolanda Hadid

title: The strong bond of friendship is not always a balanced equation; friendship is not always about giving and taking in equal shares. Instead, friendship is grounded in a feeling that you know exactly who will be there for you when you need something, no matter what or when.
author: Simon Sinek

title: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
author: Robert Southey

title: Every friendship goes through ups and downs. Dysfunctional patterns set in; external situations cause internal friction; you grow apart and then bounce back together.
author: Mariella Frostrup

title: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

title: Of course, the E.U. were never going to welcome Brexit. Some sour grapes were inevitable. That's why we worked hard to leave on positive terms, extending the arm of friendship.
author: Dominic Raab

title: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.
author: Maria Shriver

title: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

title: However rare true love may be, it is less so than true friendship.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

title: Friendship is Love without his wings!
author: Lord Byron

title: Love is friendship set on fire.
author: Jeremy Taylor

title: I have a loyalty that runs in my bloodstream, when I lock into someone or something, you can't get me away from it because I commit that thoroughly. That's in friendship, that's a deal, that's a commitment. Don't give me paper - I can get the same lawyer who drew it up to break it. But if you shake my hand, that's for life.
author: Jerry Lewis

title: All lasting business is built on friendship.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

title: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.
author: Ann Landers

title: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
author: Anton Chekhov

title: If we listened to our intellect, we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go into business, because we'd be cynical. Well, that's nonsense. You've got to jump off cliffs all the time and build your wings on the way down.
author: Ray Bradbury

title: People come in and out of our lives, and the true test of friendship is whether you can pick back up right where you left off the last time you saw each other.
author: Lisa See

title: If you do something with acceptance and kindness, you can create a true friendship.
author: Dustin Lance Black

title: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
author: John Wooden

title: Friendship's the wine of life: but friendship new... is neither strong nor pure.
author: Edward Young

title: Pak-China friendship is higher than Himalayas, deeper than ocean, sweeter than honey, and stronger than steel.
author: Shehbaz Sharif

title: The two most misused words in the entire English vocabulary are love and friendship. A true friend would die for you, so when you start trying to count them on one hand, you don't need any fingers.
author: Larry Flynt

title: One look at an email can rob you of 15 minutes of focus. One call on your cell phone, one tweet, one instant message can destroy your schedule, forcing you to move meetings, or blow off really important things, like love, and friendship.
author: Jacqueline Leo

title: We are aware that globalization doesn't mean global friendship but global competition and, therefore, conflict. That doesn't mean we will all destroy each other, but it is no happy global village, either.
author: Rene Girard

title: Real friendship, like real poetry, is extremely rare - and precious as a pearl.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

title: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
author: Samuel Butler

title: A healthy friendship is one where you share your true feelings without fearing the end of the relationship. It's also one where you sometimes have to let things that bug you slide. The tough moments will make you wiser about yourself and each other. They will also make you stronger and closer as friends.
author: Rachel Simmons

title: I think friendship is more important than love, but that love that grows out of friendship is the very best of all.
author: Jane Green

title: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: I only understand friendship or scorched earth.
author: Roger Ailes

title: CPEC is an epoch-making project going to put Pakistan-China friendship and their economic cooperation to new heights.
author: Shehbaz Sharif

title: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

title: Love, friendship, networking - these are all critical connections and the foundation of a healthy, happy life.
author: Whitney Wolfe Herd

title: Friendship is a wildly underrated medication.
author: Anna Deavere Smith

title: Great is the victory, but the friendship of all is greater.
author: Emil Zatopek

title: The love that comes from friendship is the underlying facet of a happy life.
author: Chelsea Handler

title: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
author: Lord Byron

title: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

title: Maintenance of good relations with the neighbours, friendship to all, malice to none is the policy I pursue throughout my life.
author: Sheikh Hasina

title: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
author: David Storey

title: Some people are willing to betray years of friendship just to get a little bit of the spotlight.
author: Lauren Conrad

title: One friend in a lifetime is much, two are many, three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.
author: Henry Adams

title: Marriage is the highest state of friendship. If happy, it lessens our cares by dividing them, at the same time that it doubles our pleasures by mutual participation.
author: Samuel Richardson

title: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

title: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity, before it is entitled to the appellation.
author: George Washington

title: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

title: Football is about sacrifice, dedication, a lot of work, and friendship off the pitch.
author: Edinson Cavani

title: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
author: St. Jerome

title: I force people to have coffee with me, just because I don't trust that a friendship can be maintained without any other senses besides a computer or cellphone screen.
author: John Cusack

title: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and have her nonsense respected.
author: Charles Lamb

title: I think it's important to have closure in any relationship that ends - from a romantic relationship to a friendship. You should always have a sense of clarity at the end and know why it began and why it ended. You need that in your life to move cleanly into your next phase.
author: Jennifer Aniston

title: A gang is the same as a wolf pack; gang members do not use their energies in friendship with one another, for they do not know what friendship is. If they are united, it is by the common bond of a desire to attack their world.
author: Haniel Long

title: We have a saying in the Marine Corps and that is 'no better friend, no worse enemy, than a U.S. Marine.' We always hope for the first, friendship, but are certainly more than ready for the second.
author: John F. Kelly

title: The greatest sweetener of human life is Friendship. To raise this to the highest pitch of enjoyment, is a secret which but few discover.
author: Joseph Addison

title: I define friendship as a bond that transcends all barriers. When you are ready to expect anything and everything from friends, good, bad or ugly... that's what I call true friendship.
author: Harbhajan Singh

title: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?
author: Dennis Prager

title: A woman may very well form a friendship with a man, but for this to endure, it must be assisted by a little physical antipathy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
author: St. Jerome

title: If you spend five minutes with your worst enemy - it doesn't have to be about race, it could be about anything... you will find that you both have something in common. As you build upon those commonalities, you're forming a relationship and as you build about that relationship, you're forming a friendship.
author: Daryl Davis

title: The enemies cannot destroy the king who has at his service the respect and friendship of the wise men who can find fault, disagree, and correct him.
author: Thiruvalluvar

title: Music is the social act of communication among people, a gesture of friendship, the strongest there is.
author: Malcolm Arnold

title: Nobody ever chooses the already unfortunate as objects of his loyal friendship.
author: Lucan

title: Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

title: Since the Korean War, U.S. and South Korea have established an enduring friendship with shared interests, such as denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula, combating aggression abroad and developing our economies.
author: Charles B. Rangel

title: A lot of times, in our culture and our society, we put romantic love somehow on a higher plane than self-love and friendship love. You can't do that. You have to honor and really fully invest in all these different loving relationships.
author: Delilah

title: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.
author: Charles de Lint

title: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.
author: Ernie Banks

title: To build a friendship takes so much time and so many years. To ruin it, just seconds.
